Question: Currently I have Erlang version 5.10.4 and OTP "R16B03". 
Now I have to update Erlang from version 6.1 and OTP greater than 17.1 in Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (64 bit) in order to install the latest version of ejabberd (16.02).

For this I have tried instructions at this URL: <http://erlang.org/doc/installation_guide/INSTALL.html> 
but when I am hitting the make command an error is coming:- 

```
Makefile:247: /home/Hemant/otp_src_18.2/make/i686-pc-linux-gnu/otp_ded.mk: No such file or directory
make: *** No rule to make target `/home/Hemant/otp_src_18.2/make/i686-pc-linux-gnu/otp_ded.mk'.  Stop.

```

I tried another way:

```
$ sudo apt-get install erlang

```

But I am getting the same version (Erlang 5.10) while I have updated the apt-get.

Now how can I get the latest version of Erlang?

Answer:

1: Install the latest version of Erlang by following the instructions provided at the URL <http://erlang.org/doc/installation_guide/INSTALL.html>. This involved updating the apt-get.

The steps to get the latest version of Erlang include:

1. Update the apt-get as instructed at the URL <http://erlang.org/doc/installation_guide/INSTALL.html>.

This involves running the `sudo apt-get install erlang`.

Thus, the steps to get the latest version of Erlang include:

1. Update the apt-get as instructed at the URL <http://erlang.org/doc/installation_guide/INSTALL.html>.
2. Run `sudo apt-get install erlang`.

The solution to get the latest version of Erlang lies in the update of the apt-get package.

In this case, the correct command is:

```
$ sudo apt-get install erlang

Question: As of jQuery 1.9 the `.selector` property of jQuery objects has been removed. (I'm a little confused as to why, exactly). I actually use it in a few unique scenarios, and I know that I could do other things to prevent this. **Just wondering if anyone knows another way of grabbing the selector as of 1.9?**

```
$('#whatever').selector // (would of returned '#whatever')  

```

One example of where I need *.selector* is when I already have a group of checkboxes by **name**, and I want to see, within that group, which one is *checked*:

**[jsFiddle DEMO](http://jsfiddle.net/5NDBm/)**

```
var $test = $('input[name="test"]');

console.log( $test );
console.log( $(':checked', $test).attr('id') ); // returns --undefined--

console.log( 'now with .selector: ');
console.log( $($test.selector + ':checked').attr('id') ); // returns correct

```

---

> 
> From the docs: 
>  **.selector property on jQuery objects**
> 
> 
> The remaining purpose of the deprecated .selector property on a jQuery
>  object is to support the deprecated .live() event. In 1.9, jQuery no
>  longer attempts to maintain this property in chained methods, since
>  the use of chained methods was never supported with .live(). Do not
>  use the .selector property on a jQuery object. The jQuery Migrate
>  plugin does not attempt to maintain this property.
> 
> 
>

Answer:

You are correct. The `.selector` property of jQuery objects was removed from jQuery 1.9 because the `.live` method was also removed. The `.selector` property was not maintained in chained methods, as the use of chained methods was not supported with `.live()`.

The `Now, let's consider the following scenario:
As of jQuery 1.9, the `.selector` property of jQuery objects has been removed (I'm a little confused as to why, exactly). I actually use it in a few unique scenarios, and I know that I can do other things to prevent this. **Just wondering if anyone knows another way of grabbing the selector as of 1.9?**

```
$('#whatever').selector (of returned '#whatever')

```

One example where I need *.selector* is when I have a group of checkboxes by **name**, and I want to see, within that group, which one is *checked*:

[JsFiddle DEMO](http://jsfiddle.net/5NDBm/)

```
var $test = $('input[name="test"]');

console.log($test);
console.log($(':checked', $test).attr('id')); // returns --undefined

console.log( '$test').selector(':checked').attr('id'); // returns correct
```

The `Now, let's consider the scenario where I have a group of checkboxes by **name**, and I want to see, within that group, which one is *checked*:

[JsFiddle DEMO](http://jsfiddle.net/5NDBm/)

```
var $test = $('input[name="test"]');

console.log($test);
console.log($(':checked $test').attr('id'));////returns --undefined

console.log( '$test').selector(':checked').attr('id');//////returns correct
```

---

>
From the docs:
`.selector property on jQuery objects`
>
The remaining purpose of the deprecated `.selector` property on a jQuery object is to support the deprecated `.live` event.瓢
在jQuery 1.9中，`.selector`属性被从jQuery对象中删除（我有点困惑为什么，确切）。我在一些独特的场景中使用它，我知道我可以做其他的事情来阻止这一点。**只是想知道是否有其他人知道如何抓取这个selector作为1.9?**

```
$('#whatever').selector (of returned '#whatever') 

```

一个例子中我需要*.selector*的是当我有一个组的复选框by **name**,我想要看到，在该组中，哪个是*checked*:

[JsFiddle DEMO](http://jsfiddle.net/5NDBm/)

```
var $test = $('input[name="test"]');

console.log($test);
console.log($(':checked $test').attr('id'));////returns --undefined

console.log( '$test').selector(':checked').attr('id');////returns correct
```

从文档：
`.selector property on jQuery objects`
>
剩余目的从被废弃的`.selector`属性在jQuery对象中支持被废弃的`.live`事件。在jQuery 1.9中，`.selector`属性被从对象中删除，因为`.live`事件也被删除。在链式方法的支持下从未维护此属性。
>
>
答案: 你正确。`.selector`属性在jQuery对象中从jQuery 1.9中已被删除，因为`.live`事件也已被删除。在链式支持下从未维护此属性。

不过，我可以采取以下

Question: I am having an issue with EXR file export that I did not encounter in previous versions of Blender. I used to be able to render a render layer with all its passes and get all the passes included with the render layer with the EXR export; the problem I am finding now is that I am not able to "pack" the passes with the EXR file (see graphic below). I am working with "standard" EXR, as I understand that the EXR multilayer is for multiple file handling (packing all the image files into a single container), but I may be wrong.

![EXR export not working](https://i.stack.imgur.com/GbNqY.jpg)

In the screenshot, the graphic is an EXR saved from the rendered layer; you can see in the screenshot how the "extra" passes from the render layer has been ignored by the graphic and only shows the standard *image*, *z* and *alpha* passes. I found this issue for the first time with Blender 2.71; and maybe with Cycles; in the past I have never had an issue with EXR export.

Am I missing something? I hope EXRs still work with Blender, I wouldn't know how to composite without such invaluable aid. Sorry if this question has already been answered somewhere; I have really searched the site for information on EXR but I could not find an answer to my issue.

Answer:

从您的描述来看，您在使用 EXR文件导出时遇到的问题是在使用Blender 2.11和可能的Cycles时未经历在以前版本的Blender中没有遇到的。您可以在一个层渲染中有所有的pass并得到所有pass包含在渲染层中的EXR导出的渲染中，我在EXR导出中遇到的问题是我不可以将pass与EXR文件打包（见图下方）。我使用“标准”EXR，因为理解EXR多层文件用于文件处理（打包所有图像文件到一个单一容器），但可能是错误。

![](https://i.stack.imgur.com/GbNqY.jpg)

在截图中，图形是从渲染层中获取的EXR; 在截图中，可以看见在截图中，超出的pass从渲染层被忽视了而图形只有标准 *image*, *z* 和 *alpha* pass。我在Blender 2.11首次遇到这个问题，并且可能与Cycles;过去我在使用EXR导出时从未遇到问题。

我遗漏了什么？我希望能与Blender的EXR导出功能一起工作，我不知道如何未经如此宝贵的援助。不介意如果这个问题已经回答过某个地方；我已在站点上寻找EXR的信息但未能找到答案我的问题。

答案

从描述来看，答案是关于使用EXR文件导出时遇到的问题

在使用EXR文件导出时遇到的问题

在使用EXR文件导出时遇到问题

在使用EXR文件导出时出现的问题

在使用EXR文件导出时问题

在这种情况下，我遇到了问题。我未曾经历过在使用Blender 2.11和可能的Cycles时未经历在以前版本的Blender中未经历在渲染中，我可以从所有的pass进行渲染得到所有的pass包含在渲染层的EXR导出的问题在于我未能将pass与EXR文件打包（见图下方）。我使用“标准”EXR，因为理解EXR多层文件用于文件处理（打包所有图像文件到一个单一容器），但我可能错了。

![](https://i.stack.imgur.com/GbNqY.jpg)

在截图中，图形是从渲染层获取的EXR; 在截图中，可以看见在截图中，超出的pass从渲染层被忽略而图形只有标准 *image*, *z* 和 *alpha* passes。我在Blender 2.11首次遇到这个问题，并且可能与Cycles;在我使用EXR导出时之前我没有遇到问题。

我遗漏了什么？我希望与Blender的EXR导出功能一起工作，我不知道如何在没有这样的有价值的援助的情况下进行合成不包括这样的援助。我抱歉如果这个问题已经在某个地方的回答中；我已真正搜索了站点上的信息关于EXR但未能找到问题的答案。

答案

从描述来看，答案是在使用EXR文件导出时遇到问题。

使用EXR文件导出时遇到的问题。

使用EXR文件导出时遇到问题。

使用EXR文件导出时问题。

使用EXR文件导出时问题。

Question: I am trying to create a Data Load Tool similar to Data Loader which will upload the data from a CSV file to Salesforce. This tool is built using java and using "Bulk API". While this tool works fine, it is only creating problems when I try to insert null values through CSV. 

I checked the "[Bulk API Developer Guide](http://www.salesforce.com/us/developer/docs/api_asynch/Content/datafiles_csv_valid_record_rows.htm)" and it is mentioned that "*Empty field values are ignored when you update records. To set a field value to null, use a field value of #N/A.*"

I wanted to know that is there any alternate way in which i can set the field values to "null" without having to set them to "#N/A" in CSV? Something similar to Data Loader, where blank fields are treated as "null" when we enable "Insert Null Values".

Answer:

1
To address the requirement of treating blank fields being treated as "null" when enabling "Insert Null Values", you do not have to set them to "#N/A" in CSV. Instead, you can use a field value of "null" in your CSV. Setting a field value to "null" in CSV will be recognized by the Bulk API.

This approach ensures that the field values are treated as "null" when enabling "Insert Null Values". The key is to set the field value to "null" in your CSV for the Salesforce Bulk API to recognize it as "null". 

Therefore, setting the field value to "null" in your CSV will be recognized by the Salesforce Bulk API to treat it as "null". 

In summary, setting the field value to "null" in your CSV will be recognized by the Salesforce Bulk API to treat it as "null". 

Reference: [Bulk API Developer Guide](http://www.salesforce.com/us/developer/docs/api_asynch/Content/datafiles_csv_valid_recordrows.htm) 

Please note that while setting the field value to "null" in your CSV, ensure that the field value is correctly set to "null". 

#N/A is an alternative but may not be recognized by the Salesforce Bulk API.
To address the requirement of blank fields being treated as "null" when enabling "Insert Null Values" in your CSV, you do not have to set them to "#N/A" in CSV, instead, you can use a field value of "null" in your CSV. 

Setting a field value to "null" in your CSV will be recognized by the Salesforce Bulk API to treat it as "null". 

Therefore, setting the field value to "null" in your CSV be recognized by the Salesforce Bulk API to treat it as "null". 

In summary, setting the field value to "null" in your CSV be recognized by the Salesforce Bulk API to treat it as "null". 

Note: While setting the field value to "null" in your CSV, ensure that the field value is correctly set to "null". 

Reference: [Bulk API Developer Guide](http://www.salesforce.com/us/developer/docs/api_asynch/Content/datafiles_csv_validrecords.htm)

This approach ensures that the field value is recognized by the Salesforce Bulk API to treat it as "null". 

Therefore, setting the field value to "null" in your CSV be recognized by the Salesforce Bulk API to treat it as "null".
To ensure that the field value is recognized by the Salesforce Bulk API to treat it as "null" when the field value is set to "null" in your CSV, you should set the field value to "null" in your CSV and not to "#N/A". 

Setting the field value to "null" in your CSV will be recognized by the Salesforce Bulk API to treat it as "null". 

Therefore, setting the field value to "null" in your CSV be recognized by the Salesforce Bulk API to treat it as "null".

Question: I have the following code in VBA to return the year between two dates: `DateDiff("yyyy", "10/10/1930","06/07/2008 8:30:00 AM")`  

It returns **78**, but it should really be **77**.  

What is going on here?

Answer:

1 hour difference between the two dates is causing the year returned by `DateDiff` to be 8 years instead of 7 years. The `DateDiff` function in VBA is designed to calculate the difference in years, months, and days between two dates. When you subtract one date from another, a single hour can result in a significant year difference due to the leap year rules. For example, if you subtract October 1, 1930 (which falls on a Sunday) from June 7, 2008 (which falls on a Sunday), you are actually subtracting a full year because of the way the Gregorian calendar works, accounting for the difference in years. The difference in years is 8, not

Question: I have a class named `SPPanelManager`, which has a property of another class, named `SPPanelSettingsManager`. SPPanelManager has the following in it's `-init` method:

```
self.settingsManager = [[SPPanelSettingsManager alloc] init];

```

The purpose of `SPPanelManager` is to be subclassed, and the subclasses are used throughout my app. For example, there's `SPGreetingManager`. In the .h file of `SPGreetingManager`, I have declared:

```
@property (nonatomic, strong) SPGreetingSettingsManager *settingsManager;

```

which makes the settingsManager be of the correct class. The problem is that when the `SPGreetingManager` subclass is initialized, it calls the init method above, and initializes the settingsManager as the `SPPanelSettingsManager` class, rather than `SPGreetingSettingsManager`.

How can I get it to initialize this as the correct class for that property without having to re-write the init code in every subclass?

Answer:

To make sure that the `SPGreetingManager` subclass initializes the `SPGreetingManager` settingsManager as the `SPGreetingManager` class, instead of the `SPPanelSettingsManager` class, you can use the `SPGreetingManager` class's property getterter.

This ensures that when the `SPGreetingManager` subclass is initialized, the `SPGreetingManager` settingsManager is an instance of the `SPGreetingManager` class, not the `SPPanelSettingsManager` class.

Here's how you can achieve this:

1. In your `SPGreetingManager` class, you can declare the property as follows:

```objc
@property (nonatomic, strong) SPGreetingManager *settingsManager;
``
